item.description:
The car us reg up north Yet we have had intelligent by PC Langley Plumstead police that the vehicle is in fact used by the daughter carol hole 36 ditishim all year round It has also been brought to my attention who lives opposite her in the close she drives it under the influence of cocaine been seen ballooning at the wheel all whil selling drugs from that car she uses the disable sign when she goes festival and night events raves

item.title: More pedestrian lights needed, 28th July
item.description:
Only two of the four roads on this busy junction have pedestrian lights despite the fact the road markings indicate a pedestrian crossing. As a buggy user this has made it difficult to safely cross the road and the markings are deceptive. Adding pedestrian lights to the East side of Abbey Road and the South side of Tower B Road would greatly improve safety and the general experience for pedestrians on an already busy road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Abbey Street, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ongoing Fly-Tipping at Corner of 1 Camberwell Road, 28th July
item.description:
Dear Southwark Council, I am writing to raise my continued concern regarding the persistent issue of daily fly-tipping at the corner of 1 Camberwell Road. I have reported this matter several times previously, yet the issue remains unresolved. Each time I submit a report, the case is marked as “fixed,” but unfortunately, the problem persists on a daily basis. It appears that no lasting solution has been put in place, and the area continues to attract waste dumping, which not only poses a health and safety risk but also affects the overall appearance and quality of life in the neighbourhood. I would appreciate it if this matter could be investigated thoroughly, and more permanent or proactive measures implemented to prevent future occurrences. Regular monitoring or CCTV enforcement may be necessary in this location. Please confirm how this issue will now be addressed moving forward.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2b, Westmoreland Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light timings dangerous for pedestrians, 28th July
item.description:
Vehicles turning right from Grange Road onto Tower Bridge Road are forced to drive through the ‘green man’ signal on the latter road. This is due to the traffic light timings. Unfortunately drivers cannot see that the green man is showing for pedestrians which is obviously a hazard and gives those crossing a false sense of security when in fact’s motorists will often speed through.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Decima Street, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
